RT @borjasotomayor: @AlexCEngler @StatStas @UChicagoMPCS @cmgiven Yup, we've used chisubmit in a class with 200+ students and a staff of 10â€¦
@borjasotomayor @StatStas @UChicagoMPCS @cmgiven So I imagine this is particularly helpful for the larger courses with distributed grading w/ TA's - makes a lot of sense.
@borjasotomayor @StatStas @UChicagoMPCS @cmgiven Until someone trains neural networks to identify the misuse of visual encodings... Someone wanna get on that? #deeplearning #dataviz
@borjasotomayor @StatStas @UChicagoMPCS @cmgiven For dataviz all the assignments are totally open ended (students choose data and graph types) so automatic grading seems off the table, hah.
@StatStas @UChicagoMPCS @borjasotomayor @cmgiven The automatic grading code sounds interesting, hah. I'm assuming these were not open ended assignments =p
@StatStas @UChicagoMPCS @borjasotomayor Understandable. That's what @cmgiven and I did last year, too. We did Git for workflow and submission but then BlackBoard/Email for grading.
@PiotrLe @UChicagoMPCS @McCourtSchool Yep. Sadly the GUI won't let you do everything you'll want to with Git over the long term. Others may disagree but it's worth using the CLI
@PiotrLe @UChicagoMPCS @McCourtSchool Just try to get used to the add/commit/push cycle. At least then you have an extra copy of your code on GitHub. Then maybe try a branch.
@PiotrLe @UChicagoMPCS @McCourtSchool Lots of people use git without 'getting' the whole thing. The reality is that if you self teach it might take a while for it to sink in.
@PiotrLe @UChicagoMPCS @McCourtSchool So fair warning, Git is conceptually trick if you're new to version control. That said, I like this tutorial: https://t.co/GwGZLsoYPb
@StatStas @UChicagoMPCS @borjasotomayor I've been strongly encouraging people to put them on their resume - prominently. Turns out it's really easy to say you know R/Python/D3/Spa
.@UChicagoMPCS @cmgiven For real though, how much time would this have saved us? My estimate: Oodles.
.@UChicagoMPCS @borjasotomayor ...any serious employer in this field will ask for a GitHub account. We need to encourage students to get their work on GitHub early & often
.@UChicagoMPCS Serious H/T to @borjasotomayor. Institutionalizing Git in student workflow is good for the obvious reason, Git. But also
.@UChicagoMPCS Paging #dataviz & #datascience profs - this seems like it solves the dual system problem of feedback on Git and grading in Blackboard/Canvas
COOL. @UChicagoMPCS has a system for assignment submission & grading entirely through git: https://t.co/leRIyw1YHk https://t.co/MePUYoeAfZ
